title: Tristan Newcomb - Summer of the Chew Toy Soul (2011) (XVID)
description:
Summer of the Chew Toy Soul (2011) - Tristan Newcomb

Alcohol-fueled regret and Nintendo 64 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ a marriage made in anti-movie heaven.  This is a film dedicated to any poor lad of the last thirty years who was unlucky enough to be that one miserable kid on the block without a video game console.  Or any Nintendo-loving child who suffered through the divorce of their parents by being tossed back-and-forth between their two separate residences like an old, stinky Nerf football that the dog chewed onÃ¢â‚¬Â¦while their Nintendo console kept up its merrily oblivious song of Pikachuvian bliss.

But yet, from the point-of-view of the filmÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s functional-alcoholic father character, this movie is a riff on CamusÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ famous dictum: the only real philosophical problem is whether or not to commit suicide.  Once youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve decided that particular issue, the rest of lifeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s answers are, by comparison, simple.  The father just isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t quite up to making a firm decision on the suicide question.  Perhaps his Nintendo-loving son can assist him in making the wrong suicide choice for the right reasons?  Or is it the other way around?
